title: 2-year-old falls into abandoned 30 ft shaft in Rajshahi
body: A two-year-old boy fell into an abandoned deep tube-well shaft, about 30 feet deep, in Tanore upazila of Rajshahi today, prompting a rescue operation by the Fire Service and local residents. The child, Sazid, is the son of Rakib Uddin and Runa Khatun of Koel Hat Purbo Para village in Panchandar union of the upazila, police said. According to police and locals, a trolley carrying earth got stuck after one of its tyres sank deep into the ground around noon in the village. Rakib Uddin, along with his wife Runa Khatun and their son Shwadhin, went to see the trolley in the field. Tanore Police Station Officer-in-Charge Shahinuzzaman said around 1:00pm, the two-year-old got down from his mother's lap and was walking around the field when he suddenly slipped and fell into narrow abandoned deep tube-well shaft. "The rescue effort is still underway," he said, adding that the parents initially tried to pull him out but failed. Receiving information, firefighters rushed to the spot. They, along with local residents, are digging the ground next to the shaft to rescue the child. Tanore Fire Service official Abdur Rouf said the rescue team has not been able to take the child out of the hole yet. "We are not sure if the child is still alive. Excavators are being used to dig the soil. We are trying our best to retrieve him as quickly as possible," he said. Rescue efforts were ongoing till the filing of this report at 9:30pm.
